thread.title: TV best bets: Thur., October 8 - TV
thread.title_full: TV best bets: Thur., October 8 - TV - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: TV best bets: Thur., October 8 - TV
text:
8 p.m., CW/CHANNEL 11: The Vampire Diaries — As fans of the series know, founding cast member Nina Dobrev will be absent from season seven, which starts with "Day One of Twenty-Two Thousand, Give or Take." Damon (Ian Somerhalder) tries to move forward without Elena, as Bonnie (Kat Graham) keeps close watch over him. Meanwhile, he looks out for Alaric (Matt Davis), who has suffered his own loss. Lily’s (guest star Annie Wersching) campaign against Mystic Falls brings Stefan (Paul Wesley) to the rescue. 
8 p.m., FOX: Bones — Booth’s (David Boreanaz) safety is imperiled further when FBI Agent Miller (guest star Kim Raver), who supposedly has been helping to locate him, is found to be withholding information in the new episode "The Brother in the Basement." A forensic scientist (guest star Josh Casaubon) arrives to aid the search. Arastoo (guest star Pej Vahdat) comes to a decision that’s destined to impact Cam (Tamara Taylor) as well. Emily Deschanel and TJ Thyne also star. 
9 p.m., FOX: Sleepy Hollow — If you know about Pandora’s box, you can see what the effects of it could be in the new episode "Whispers in the Dark." Ichabod and Abbie (Tom Mison, Nicole Beharie) must deal with the related powers of Pandora (Shannyn Sossamon, "Wayward Pines"), which force them to come to terms with aspects of their respective pasts.
10 p.m., NBC: The Player — Interesting throwback— the 1995 Al Pacino-Robert De Niro movie "Heat" was based on a TV movie called "L.A. Takedown," which also is the title of this new episode. Mr. Johnson (Wesley Snipes) puts himself in the way when Alex (Philip Winchester) tries to find out more about Ginny’s murder.
